alert.note: Alert for Culpeper; Southern Fauquier (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 2:18AM EST until January 10 at 10:51PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River at Remington affecting Culpeper and Southern Fauquier zones. For the Rappahannock River...including Remington, Fredericksburg, Fredericksburg...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rappahannock River at Remington. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Tin Pot Run Road and Sumerduck Road near Remington are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 3.9 feet, or 11.1 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Tue Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Rappahannock River Remington 15.0 3.9 Tue 1 am 3.7 4.9 9.0 15.9 1pm Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1030 AM EST.
